nodes.bodyText:
IMO we should separate the ports used to connect clients to remote endpoints (where we only need the port to be open on the server) and the ports used internally (where we need every node to connect to every other node).
I'd also change the text to say "TCP and UDP ports" instead of "ports and protocols", because we can't mix-and-match, and add "default" somewhere, because all of them can be changed by the user.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,52 @@
+[id='ports_protocols-{context}']
+= Ports and Protocols
+{brandname} uses the following ports and protocols to allow network traffic
+between remote endpoints and clustered nodes:

nodes.bodyText: thanks @danberindei that's a good suggestion. helped me get a handle on the content.

+between remote endpoints and clustered nodes:

nodes.bodyText:
@tristantarrant do you remember how we ended up using 11221 as the default memcached port? In the WildFly-based server it used to be 11211 (Memcached's default):
https://github.com/infinispan/infinispan/blob/9.4.x/server/integration/endpoint/src/main/resources/subsystem-templates/infinispan-endpoint.xml#L166

@@ -0,0 +1,52 @@
+[id='ports_protocols-{context}']
+= Ports and Protocols
+{brandname} uses the following ports and protocols to allow network traffic
+between remote endpoints and clustered nodes:
+
+[%header,cols=3*]
+|===
+|Port
+|Protocol
+|Description
+
+|11222
+|TCP
+|Hot Rod and REST endpoint access
+
+|11221

@@ -0,0 +1,52 @@
+[id='ports_protocols-{context}']
+= Ports and Protocols
+{brandname} uses the following ports and protocols to allow network traffic
+between remote endpoints and clustered nodes:
+
+[%header,cols=3*]
+|===
+|Port
+|Protocol
+|Description
+
+|11222
+|TCP
+|Hot Rod and REST endpoint access
+
+|11221
+|TCP
+|Memcached endpoint access
+
+|7800
+|TCP/UDP
+|JGroups cluster bind port
+
+|46655
+|TCP/UDP
